user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of add_response_entry_n:
```c
static bool
add_response_entry_n (struct MHD_Response *response,
                      enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                      const char *header,
                      size_t header_len,
                      const char *content,
                      size_t content_len)
{
  if (NULL == response)
    return false;
  if (0 == header_len)
    return false;
  if (0 == content_len)
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\t', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, ' ', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\r', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\n', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\r', content_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\n', content_len))
    return false;

  return MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_ (response, kind, header, header_len,
                                           content, content_len);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
static bool
add_response_entry_n (struct MHD_Response *response,
                      enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                      const char *header,
                      size_t header_len,
                      const char *content,
                      size_t content_len)

return MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_ (response, kind, header, header_len,
                                           content, content_len);
explanation: Only the listed fragments need further investigation for Rule 17.2. The other lines in the function are simple parameter/null/length checks and calls to the standard library function memchr; these do not perform calls back into this function (they are not user-defined functions that could call add_response_entry_n). There are no other user-defined function calls in this body that could introduce direct or indirect recursion, so no other fragments warrant investigation.
